text: I saw that there is a free training and
free self-paced lab on Amazon s3 have
you heard about Amazon s3 sure Amazon
simple storage service also known as
Amazon s3 is safe secure highly scalable
object storage in the cloud it can be
used to store and retrieve any amount of
data at any time from anywhere on the
web why do people need storage in the
cloud it makes it easy to store as much
data as you want and access it when you
need it and you avoid having to buy
hardware and paying for storage that
isn't being used amazon s3 is a very
affordable solution for hosting data on
the web since you only pay for the
storage and bandwidth you use companies
commonly use amazon s3 for backup and
storage application or media hosting
hosting high traffic websites or for
software delivery for example let's say
you want to build a website for your
business or a family blog you can store
the static content in amazon s3 for
faster retrieval and reduces costs you
can also use amazon s3 to securely store
your information and backup your
critical data off-site it also allows
versioning so you have a record of
changes and can roll back to any
previous version when needed but how
reliable is Amazon s3 is it safe amazon
s3 is designed for 99.99 percent
durability it is very reliable and is
already being used by startups to
Fortune 1000 companies worldwide you
would be surprised how many companies
already use Amazon s3 so how hard is it
to use Amazon s3 is easy to use there
are several ways to manage and
administer your data amazon s3 provides
standards-based rest and soap web
services api's so you can
programmatically store retrieve and
manage your data most developers
building applications on amazon s3 use
the software development kit sdk which
wraps the underlying REST API
what are the other ways to access this
product you can also access amazon s3
using the command line interface or the
AWS management console which is a simple
web interface awesome I think I'm ready
to get started how do I access the free
training before you get started working
with Amazon s3 it is important to
understand a few things amazon s3 stores
data as objects and objects are stored
within folders that are called buckets
to store an object in amazon s3 you
upload the file you want to store to a
bucket when you upload a file you can
set permissions on the object so it's
private till you want to share it
buckets are the containers for objects
you can have one or more buckets for
each bucket you can control access to
the bucket such as who can create delete
and list objects in the bucket let me
show you how easy it is to create a
bucket add an object view it move it and
delete it in Amazon s3 anyone can sign
up for a free account in the AWS
management console here you will access
AWS products and services such as Amazon
s3 click on the Amazon s3 icon on the
AWS management console home page to
access this service
click create bucket to create a place to
upload your objects
enter a bucket name
we are going to keep the default region
and click create here is the new bucket
after you create a bucket you cannot
change its name that name is visible in
the URL that points to the objects
stored in that bucket well my account be
charged if I delete a bucket and create
a new one with a different name no you
are not charged for creating a bucket
you were only charged for storing
objects in the bucket so I noticed there
is an option to change regions water
regions and when would I change that AWS
has regions all over the world different
AWS applications are run by region
utilizing regions can significantly
reduce latency to end users since data
or applications they need to access can
be geographically closer you can choose
a region to optimize latency minimize
costs or address regulatory requirements
let me show you how to upload data to
Amazon s3 click upload click add files
select the file to be uploaded click
open click start upload
here is the new object in your bucket
are there limitations on what an object
can be an object can be any kind of file
a text photo video or application do you
have to upload one file at a time now
you can upload an entire folder but you
must click enable enhanced uploader to
install the necessary Java applet you
only need to do this once per console
session let me show you how to view the
object in your Amazon s3 bucket right
click the object you want to open or
download
scroll down and click open
here is our object I'm going to close
this window to go back i'm going to
quickly create another new bucket
you
now we have two new buckets
here you can open download make public
rename or delete the object
is it this easy to delete buckets it's
very easy let me show you right click
the bucket name you want to delete
select delete
now we just have the one new bucket we
created very cool thanks sure now that
you have seen me do it go practice and
try it out on your own go to run quick
labs com to try it out with a free
self-paced lab while you're there check
out the other free AWS introduction
trainings to learn about more AWS
products and services you can play
around without having to open an account
